thread.title: "Bette Midler Sucked!": Donald Trump's Most Bizarre Oscars Tweets | Hollywood Reporter
thread.title_full: "Bette Midler Sucked!": Donald Trump's Most Bizarre Oscars Tweets | Hollywood Reporter

title: "Bette Midler Sucked!": Donald Trump's Most Bizarre Oscars Tweets | Hollywood Reporter
text:
Sign up for our Newsletters . Daily Edition "Bette Midler Sucked!": Donald Trump's Most Bizarre Oscars Tweets 6:30 AM 2/21/2017 Before he was president, Trump was convinced the Academy Awards were a yuuuge disaster. Donald Trump Steve Granitz/WireImage 2012 
Trump was outraged by Sacha Baron Cohen's red-carpet stunt, in which he spilled the "ashes" of Kim Jong-il on Ryan Seacrest. Trump also complained the Vanity Fair party was "the absolutely worst party." 2013 
He had earlier tweeted he was glad to hear Seth MacFarlane would be hosting, but then blasted best picture nominee Django Unchained and the best actor winner, Lincoln 'sDaniel Day-Lewis. 2014 
Trump panned the 86th awards, produced by Craig Zadan and Neil Meron, and particularly hated Bette Midler's "In Memoriam" ballad "Wind Beneath My Wings." 2015 
With director Alejandro G. Inarritu and cinematographer Emmanuel Lubezki winning for Birdman , Trump inveighed against Mexico — and President Obama — four months before announcing his candidacy for the presidency.
